Reformed Theological Seminary Student Housing Proposal

Solution Framework
Income-Appropriate Housing Models
Workforce Housing Target (60-120% AMI):
● Target rent: $600-$1,200 monthly
● Unit types: Studio, 1-bedroom, 2-bedroom
● Features: Energy-efficient, low maintenance, quality construction
Student Housing Specialized Options:
● Shared housing models: 2-4 bedroom units with private bedrooms
● Target rent per bedroom: $400-$600
● Furnished options with utilities included
● Study spaces and high-speed internet
Healthcare Worker Housing:
● Flexible lease terms for travel/rotation staff
● Professional-quality finishes and amenities
● Proximity to medical facilities
● 1-2 bedroom options, $800-$1,400 range
Structural Insulated Panel (SIP) Construction Advantages
Cost Effectiveness:
● SIP panels: $7-$12 per square foot
● 55% reduction in construction time compared to traditional framing
● 55% reduction in jobsite labor needs
● Lower ongoing utility costs (50% more energy-efficient than traditional construction)
Performance Benefits:
● Superior insulation (R-26 in 4.5 inches typical)
● Excellent airtightness reduces utility costs
● Stronger structural performance (2.5x stronger than traditional wood framing)
● Weather resistance beneficial for Mississippi climate
Long-term Value:
● 60% greater energy efficiency reduces operational costs
● Lower maintenance requirements
